title: how I think about LeBron’s incident

replies.msg:
Lakers’ LeBron James on NBA’s China controversy: “I don’t want to get into a ... feud with Daryl Morey but I believe he wasn’t educated on the situation at hand and he spoke.”

https://mobile.twitter.com/MarkG_Medina/status/1183915567691907073?s=20

Honestly, I am not so surprised with his wordings. Providing the fact that he is selling so many shoes in China, supporting will cost him a lot. Yet I wanna tell him that in such a informative modern society, how can a MIT MBA graduate be misled or uneducated on the situation at hand? Just go to google it and you can see what we have been through in the past 4 months.

Despite the fact that you are such a hypocrite, fear to voice out for supporting freedom, I still wanna to announce that, all Hong Kongers will not use racist wording to attack you, as well as other people worldwide. We simply cannot do that, not like the Chinese who was using 911 incident to attack your country (and you kept quiet about it, what a shame).



We, Hong Kongers will keep on fighting for freedom, with or without you.

Sorry for my bad English, but as a NBA lover and Hong Kongers, I always cherish the value of freedom and shoulder the responsibility to protect the value in this land of brave- Hong Kong.
Hope that someone can use better english to further elaborate my point
Lebron don’t flop!!!

His statement towards the recent issue is perhaps predictable since he’s running his business in China. He really DOES love Chinese money more than freedom.
